Summary Heading: Unpleasant and rude owner and/or staff
Summary: We travel to SoCal annually and I’ve always wanted to stay at the Beachcomber. This year we finally took the leap to try it and see if it may just be a our new weekly getaway hotel. Unfortunately that didn’t work out. The day we were set to arrive, SoCal was under a blizzard warning in the mountains and travel was not recommended. National weather service said not to head through the mountains to the coast. It was devastating and unheard of.   While we understood that the booking was not refundable, we called the hotel and explained our worries with traveling in that weather warning. Instead of suggesting different routes or options, or even allowing us to check in a day later or a day the following week, we were met with rudeness and belittling even though he admitted he had
Room tip: Avoid booking no refundable rooms. Book somewhere else

Summary: Don’t be fooled by the photos and the the reviews - this is a motel at best. Yes it’s a pretty setting and the fire pit is a cool feature. Otherwise expect motel level details - no air conditioning, a crazy policy that you have to be off the grounds an hour after checkout (at 11) even if you are willing to pay, a musty smell in the rooms, no way to get a breeze into the unit (those pretty large windows don’t open).  Not to mention the various imperfections in the room like a stained and cracked mirror and dirty floors that turned my feet black in five seconds. You get what you pay for.
Room tip: Plan on leaving Sam Clemente by 12, as you can’t use the grounds past then. Bring your own beach...

Summary: Absolute best view of the ocean! We will be coming back again and again to the Hotel.  The employees were so nice and the bed was comfortable. It was the most awesome Beach vacation. They have a fire pit that is on from 5-10 every night thats so inviting.
Room tip: Every room has an ocean view and full kitchen

Summary: The place is okay, but pricey for what it offers. You need to be okay with the pot smoking, as the smell of it was all over the property. The staff rent to their friends, and you might end up with a houseful of people in the room next door, smoking pot and partying. We arrived late and were weary from a long drive, but very happy to have found what looked like a cute place to stay. We stepped outside to have a cigarette. The wind was heavy and was blowing every direction. The party house next door came out within seconds and complained, so we moved far out into the lawn. The next day, we had a $250 charge on our credit card for smoking too near the building. We contested it, asked them to reverse it, explained the situation, and they refused. So, for about 20 seconds of smoking
Manager Response: Hello Odyssey749467 - We are sorry that staying at our smoke-free hotel did not work out for you.  A few staff members were working that night and did not smell any pot smells at all.  We are thinking that is an excuse you are using to write your review.  We understand your frustration.  Having signed the no smoking agreement when you checked in, you were very aware of our policy.  After reviewing the video we have, you were definitely smoking on the property, and no other guests were discourteous.  Thank you.

Summary: Although during the July 4th holiday we were forced to book a nightly minimum and special rate requirements it was absolutely the best deal and most amazing view and access to all day activities ending with the fireworks.         Totally worth the money spent and with a grass area, outdoor firepit this was a perfect ending to the holiday activities.

My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the Beachcomber Inn for the first time.  We stayed for 3 nights in the newly renovated casita and it was AMAZING!!!  The property was clean, the casita was beautifully decorated, the staff was super friendly, and the views were spectacular!!!  We can't wait to come back next year!

Darling cabins with quaint architecture and furnishings with tremendous view.  Quiet. Well maintained and excellent service. Great for a honeymoon, friends get together or just for fun.  only disappoint was no jacuzzi.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for your kind review..... I'm sorry about your disappointment about not having a Jacuzzi at our property. However we are minutes away from the beach and we want you to experience the beach.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights because we were celebrating my wife’s 60th birthday. What a gem. Everyone was so nice. There are only 12 “cottages” and every single person was very friendly. Check in was easy and the lady at the check in was extremely polite and personable. There is a great view for every “cottage” of the ocean and pier. The pier is extremely close by and an easy walk. There is a walking trail by the train tracks that is very easy to use and goes for miles. The walk is very dog friendly. You also have access to the trolley which runs until the end of September. It will take you to different parts of San Clemente and the outlets. The Beachcomber Inn is a little pricey but you will not be disappointed. If you want to go make sure you book a room at least
Manager Response: Hello Scott! Thank you for your very informative review, I'm very happy that you and your wife enjoyed your stay here at the Beachcomber Inn. Hope to see you guys soon!

Summary: The Beachcomber Inn offers clean cozy cottages with spectacular views of the Pacific and the San Clemente Pier. Our unit had a full kitchen, bath, comfy sofa and terrific outdoor patio with chairs and table. The grounds and landscaping are beautiful and well maintained with outdoor tables, umbrellas and a fire pit lit at night. It is an easy walk from the Beachcomber to the San Clemente Pier, restaurants, Casa Romantica and the beach. This was our first time to San Clemente (we came to attend a wedding) but will now consider it and the Beachcomber Inn a destination for a future vacation.
Manager Response: Hello Donna! I'm very happy to hear that you liked the Beachcomber Inn and we would love for you guys to stay with us always.

Summary: We stayed in February 2019 for our 27th wedding anniversary, we have tried to stay at the Beachcomber for years but they are always booked and we now know why. The views are awesome, and the location is great. We stayed in the South Villa room #9. you can walk to everything local and they have on-site parking. You can open the window on the door and hear the waves crashing all night long! Best place we have stayed in San Clemente! a 10+ for sure!!
Manager Response: Hello Mark! Thank you for your response and hope to see you guys soon.

Summary: The rooms overlook San Clemente pier and the beach. The window is large, just right for this wonderful view.  The bed large and comfortable, with adequate bathroom and good kitchen. Easy access to beach, great porch for sunset. We enjoyed the firepit but it turns off a bit early (10pm when we were there). Very relaxing place, even with the commuter train that runs below, between the cliff and beach. Each room has a unique decor and none has a bad view. We had a North room, which has less grass area in front and the road behind, but perhaps a better overall view. An easy walk to bars and restaurants and shops. Beach towels are available upon request.
Manager Response: Hello Nancy! Thank you for your review.... Hope to see you guys in the near future.

Summary: Been hoping to book a room here for months. Thankfully someone canceled and we snapped it up. Everything about this place is special and can’t wait to return.  We were placed in the Southern Rooms and the views and sounds from the waves crashing literally make you feel soooo relaxed.  Rooms are very clean, cutely decorated and even come with a fully stocked kitchen. The town is within walking distance so no need to ruin your mood by driving.  Excellent food options available, but Nicks is the place for top notch dining.  The wait was worth it.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you so much for your great review about your stay and our villas, our goal is to make our guest feel like home away from home but with a view.

Summary: The location is amazing - I used to live near here BUT...back in UK I wanted to visit and asked for information on 2019 pricing and booking. Their first response was brief and gave me a price which was either an 18% increase on 2018 or a 49% increase! I asked for clarification, because they hadn't read my initial email and quoted for only 7 days when I'd asked for 8, and wanted to know how I could tell which villa (or Luxury villa) I was renting. I received a very short, unhelpful and unpleasant tone message back with an increased price for the 8 days, no comment on the %age increase I'd mentioned, and told they don't guarantee any villa so you pay your money and take pot luck! Quite rude really and unhelpful - it IS a great location and good luck to those of you who visit - for
Manager Response: Hello. I'm sorry for your experience that you had at The Beachcomber Inn. You review helps us improve our service.

Summary: This small inn, actually an old motel from probably the 1940's, is on a bluff overlooking the beach and San Clemente Pier.  A marvelous view from every the front porch of every room.  The noise of the waves landing on the beach are about all you hear.  The trains going by are surprisingly quiet.  A nice restaurant is just steps away at the pier.  A nice grass area, with lounges and chairs, and a fire pit, invite a time of relaxation.  The rooms are very nice and cozy with a little kitchenette.  We have chosen the Beachcomber Inn for our annual anniversary getaway.

If you’re looking for the perfect location to get away from it all, this is it!  Beachcomber is as close as you can get to the sand & ocean. It’s at the bend in the road where locals live, so it’s private & city central at the same time.  There’s a small parking lot for renters only, and there’s metered street parking for guests. The office is not always open, but you can reach the manager by phone.  The rooms, large grass area, & BBQ overlook the ocean - perfection!   (My pics did not load in the order selected, so bounce around to view the location.😉)

We just had the privilege of staying at this hotel. So charming! From check-in to check-out this place is perfect! The rooms are incredibly clean, property is immaculate and inn keepers are absolutely accommodating and amazing! Can't wait to go back!!!

What a great find. I knew nothing about this place but what I saw on the internet and the desk person told me. I took my 90 year old aunt and we were both in heaven. They provided for our every need. We had a great bed, views, and the price was the best I could have found for a waterfront inn. We both want to bring others back. A woman checking in after me said that the “Beachcomber Inn was on my bucket list.” Imagine that!? The village was great, coffe and muffins down the block were delish.

Summary Heading: Perfect spot to enjoy San Clemente and see perfect California sunsets
Summary: I've stayed here twice and will definitely return. It's a small hotel so make sure to get reservations early, as it's always pretty full. Each room is unique, but all have front porches overlooking the Pacific Ocean. I love the firepit on the hill overlooking the beach.

Pros: Even though this list is shorter, it is awesome and keeps us coming back.  Ocean bluff front, affordable, vintage charm. Clean cute rooms, well maintained for an old property. Stunning ocean views from all rooms/front porches. Easy walking distance to pier, great food, shops. Nice family owned and managed. Perfect for couple's getaway. It's small and intimate.   Cons: It's small and intimate. Which also means not very private. Not good for groups/extended families/ small kids because even if you are friendly, careful, conscientious and following the rules, those who are not in your group will likely complain about something... your use of the grassy area of the property for games, gathering for a potluck style bbq, enjoying the fire pit as a group, rowdy little kids next

Want to give 5 stars but the bathroom ...The only negative about this hotel is the tiny bathroom in every room even the large unit. We have stayed here twice in March and June and weather was perfect both times. Rooms have everything you need and walk to everything. Love the individual porches and great views. But the bathroom! The stall shower is so narrow a larger person would never be able to use it. The bathroom has no counter tomeven put a toothbrush down so the entire bathroom is a challenge. Other than that no complaints.

Loved this ideal location and room. Perfect views. A small motel with only 12 rooms makes it a great getaway whether it's for romance or relaxation. Walking distance to the pier, beach, restaurants and more. The small kitchens are perfect for families to reduce costs. Would love to come again and stay longer. Just Beautiful!

Summary Heading: Our NEW favorite place to stay!
Summary: We were lucky to stay here for my brother's weekend wedding...WOW! What a TREAT! GREAT hotel, unlike any other that we have stayed in, and now we can't wait to go back again! The rooms are incredibly clean, property is immaculate and inn keepers are absolutely accommodating and amazing!  Beachcomber Inn is EXACTLY what a hotel / inn SHOULD be! THANKS for the GREAT weekend!

As soon as you walk down the path to your room you know you have made the right choice. The view is amazing! The rooms are a bit small but so cute and include a small kitchen. I could have sat on the verandah all day just watching the waves, surfers and dolphins. There are lots of tables and seats out the front on the grass. We had dinner there and watched the sunset. We had to check in early in the morning and they were very accomodating. Free wi-fi is great.  It is in walking distance to restaurants, the pier and the beach. There is a train track just under the bluff but most of the trains go by quickly and the sound of the ocean masks it. I would definitely recommend this inn.

We've had 2, less than perfect weather stays, at the Beachcomber.  Very happy both times.  You can sit on the porch out of the rain or lay in bed a look out the picture window, view is always there, and always impressive.

I almost don't want to give a good review because then everyone will go and we might not get a room again. I can't believe we even got one anyhow. It's SUCH a great spot!! I'm giving the good review because I think when you get such good service and have such a great experience, it needs to be shared. When we checked in the owner/manager was very nice. Our room was clean, cozy and had the most incredible view. We could walk down to the beach and onto the pier for a beer at sunset. We walked into town the next day and just had a great time wandering around. Everyone was so friendly. That night, we sat by the firepit and enjoyed the most beautiful sunset I have ever seen. Then, back to room and cooked our own dinner in the well equipped kitchen. It was the perfect weekend get away!

Summary Heading: Always the best ocean-front place to stay in SoCal
Summary: This little Inn is the by far the most quaint and charming place to stay and the best location and view in southern California.  If you're into photography, surfing, dining experiences, biking/walking, or just R&R along the ocean front then this is a must visit.  My wife and I come here often for many of the above.  The property has 12 units so booking months in advance is usually necessary.  Two of the units have more room for extra guests, i.e., kids, family, but those are usually booked out longer in advance.  Each unit has full kitchens which is great for convenience and for those on a budget.  The owners are very friendly and accommodating.  The grounds have a beautiful lawn, chase lounges, barbecues, and a fire pit so it is ideal for lounging outside feeling the ocean

We had 2 rainy nights here and absolutely lived it! Yes, there is a train track and a Metrolink station within steps of the hotel but we slept w/ the window open and it didn't really bother us. The only bummer was the size if the shower (there are no bath tubs) it is REALLY small, but the size of the kitchen is great! I had everything I needed to make a meal for some friends who came for a visit.

I can hardly put into words what an awesome place this is.   We visited for only 3 nights because they were sold out the rest of the week.  I love love love this place. First of all, Linda and the other ladies there are so helpful and nice. I must have called them a dozen times prior to arriving asking questions and getting the right room. My husband has a disability, so I was concerned about steps and walking. The were so good to us. The view was so spectacular, that we stared at it as much as possible. In the room, outside the room -- everywhere.  The room itself is adequate. The kitchen is a full kitchen, with all the flatware and pots, etc. that you need. The bathroom is small, very small. The sink has not space for hair stuff, so you will need to make do. The shower is a

The location is amazing! Cute little bungalows on a bluff with gorgeous ocean views! We walked to breakfast and dinner. There are two restaurants near the pier. The train goes right by but it's not loud and fun to watch. Bring binoculars to look for dolphin. A fun getaway!

Great location, lovely rooms, terrific view.  We used to live in San Clemente (long ago & far away), and it's nice to return to a place like this.  You can walk to several restaurants/cocktails.  We came here instead of Palm Springs this week-end, and glad we did.  We will be back!!

Summary Heading: Will be back for 3rd time ASAP!
Summary: San Clemente is a great little city. Laid back, friendly, and so picturesque. Great surfing town. The best way to experience all it has to offer is to stay at The Beachcomber. It's like having your own place on the beach. A full kitchen, king size bed, large TV, good wireless, and a large picture window facing the beach, ocean, and pier. Bring your groceries so that you can enjoy your breakfast, and morning coffee, while you sit on your own patio taking in the view.  The Beachcomber is clean; the friendly housekeepers seem to be there all of the time. The grounds are getting constant attention as well.It's obvious that the owners really care about guests' overall impression of the place. They offer a couple of BBQ's if you want to grill something or you can simply walk 5 to 10

We lucky Canadians were so happy to be back at our favourite beachfront oasis. The Beachcomber is perfect in every way. The view can't be beat! I love the short walk to town & shops. The beach & waves are simply perfect! Jimmy & Carly are so warm & friendly, they make you feel so at home. We enjoyed a wonderful week playing in the surf while watching our son learn to surf. I miss our cozy room already!

This is our second time to visit the Beachcomber Inn. We had just finished more than a week with lots of grandchildren, children, etc., and this was the perfect place to unwind. Yes, it was a splurge with the summer rates, but the room and view are indescribably lovely. If you want a hotel, go to a hotel, but you will be missing out on an experience you will remember for the rest of your life.

I travel a lot and  the service  here is the best I have seen in a long time.  You can't beat the location.  It's nice to park the car and not have to drive.  (Free parking onsite) There is good food nearby and the rooms have a full kitchen.  Each room has a nice patio as well.  Small store nearby for basic items. There are BBQ grills as well.  The rooms are nicely decorated.  We had three adults and two 11 year olds.  We were able to accommodate all of us.   Typical sofa bed :).   The beds are very comfortable. JImmy goes above and beyond to make his guests happy.   Wi fi is good and free.

Quaint place with about 12 rooms on the cliff in San Clemente with a great view of the pier and ocean. All rooms have the same great view. Small clean rooms with a small kitchen, full size appliance in there though which is nice. Community BBQ and fire pit to sit around.  Not much in walking distance for entertainment. Pier with a restaurant/bar, a liquor store and 3 other small restaurant/ cafes.   Definitely great for a quiet, romantic vacation.

Summary Heading: The best "bang-for-the-buck" ocean view stay in SoCal
Summary: The Beachcomber is so quaint and charming, and the best value for any ocean view hotel in southern California.  It doesn't have the excessive amount of amenities and glitz that large hotels offer but it's the simplicity and attention to detail applied to the grounds and the comfort of the rooms that makes it such a wonderful place.  It is the perfect place for a short get-away or R&R vacation.  The owners are very friendly and accommodating to their guests.  You would pay at least twice the price or more for something similar in terms of view and surroundings and I highly recommend this little gem of an inn for those who love going to the beach.

Summary Heading: A fantastic week by the beach
Summary: We've stayed at this little charmer for one week during each of the past two years and we absolutely love it. The motel has had a face lift in the past few years and it was well done. The setting is perfect as the property sits just above the San Clemente pier and enjoys perfect sunsets, and a beautiful view of the surf and sand. The best part of the experience is the family that runs it. Jimmy makes us feel at home and cared about each time we visit. We'll be back!

We found this place on a day trip to San Clemente and waited several months for an opening .. it was so worth the wait. The Inn is a family business and they make you feel right at home. We stayed in the "family" suite that provided some extra room for our crew. The views - incredible .The rooms are nicely decorated and comforable. There is a small kitchen which is enough to work with. The amenities are perfect. There are a couple of well maintained bbqs for your use, tables and chairs around the property to sit and enjoy the views. The beach is just a short walk away along with some small shops and resturants. Some might be worried about the train running by but they a pretty quiet and the soothing sounds of the crashing surf typically drown them out.  The staff is extremely

Summary Heading: Just what you are looking for!
Summary: I couldn't have been more impressed with this place. The location and view hardly need my review. It's the property that was so great for us. The rooms/connected villas were so perfectly decorated and equipped. Having your own patio for coffee in the morning and wine in the evening for the amazing views was my favorite part. There were also nice sun loungers and picnic tables to enjoy with the family. We enjoyed days on the beach while saving money on meals with our full kitchen. It was the perfect way to wind down after a busy couple of days at Disney Land, and the kids (6&3) loved it. The next best thing is the staff. The managers are tremendous. Their warmness and concern that all of your needs/expectations are exceeded is evident in every interaction. It was truly refreshing

Summary Heading: Beautiful location, but a disappointing stay
Summary: Almost all of my reviews on Trip Adviser have been positive as my wife and we travel a lot and are pretty easy to please. We have children and have had pets in the past-so love kids and animals.  We stayed at the Beachcomber last year for a weekend and the view and location in San Clemente can't be beat. The rooms are small but decorated like a beach escape which is what we love. The view can't be beat and even though the trains run right by there  all day and into the evening it adds to the experience.  They don't run all night so it didn't really effect us on our previous stay. We noticed last year there were quite a few families staying there crammed into several rooms but it never presented a problem for us as far as noise level,etc and there also seemed to be quite a few
Manager Response: Let me start off by saying that we really appreciate your honest review.  We wanted to reach out and offer our apologies as to what took place during your stay.  Our management team loves the challenge and opportunity to provide our guests with the best stay possible.  There will always be things that we wish we could have done better even if the guests feel that things are perfect!  We definitely take pride in our jobs here as a management team, and often times people can feel like we are even on the strict side!  We do agree that in the summer time, the rooms can get hot.  Most nights the ocean breeze sweeps through the property and offers some relief since we are right above the water, but there are some nights where we definitely feel like the rooms could use A/C, and we have made the owner aware of this.  We hope to have A/C in the rooms at some point in the future.        During the time of your stay we knew that there was a group of guests occupying multiple rooms on the wing that you were staying on.  We try our best to warn family gatherings that they need to be courteous to the guests around them as large family gatherings can be very overwhelming to guests that are not part of the family!  We actually completely agree with you on the fact that being next to a group or family can potentially ruin your stay.  Due to the fact that this particular group of guests were unable to act appropriately, even after being reminded of our quiet hours by members of our management team, they are no longer able to book with us in the future.  The group was definitely not related to the owner/management and was definitely not granted any sort of special treatment of any kind.  We understand that it definitely appeared that way by our lack of noticeable support on your behalf.   We have even entertained not allowing any group bookings to take place here at all because family gatherings are one of the hardest situations for us to manage.      We do allow up to 5 people to a room, but when potential guests ask about room size, we are very upfront with them and explain to them that we allow five but it is really "tight" with that amount of people in the room.  We try our best to be aware of how many people are in each room.  In this case, it was a family with multiple rooms and it is sometimes difficult to control who ends up in the rooms once quiet hour are in place.  Our rates are based on two people per room and there is an additional charge of 15$ per person, per night, after the first two guest (children under 8 are free but no more than 5 people total in the room) so we do have a good idea of how many people are in each room at the time of check in.  We have had a fair amount of guests tell us that we are very strict with this policy because we 100% care about how crowded our rooms are.  We realize that the more people are in a room, the potential for more noise goes up!  That nightly gathering should have absolutely taken place away from your room and we should have done a better job of reminding the guests to congregate in the areas designated for gatherings such as the fire pit or table areas. The large dog on the property........ This one is our greatest concern.  We are a strict non-smoking, non-pet property and have in fact enforced several fines for people that have not complied with these two policies.  In this particular case, this was a service dog, and with service dogs we legally cannot have them removed from the property.  The owner of the dog presented the service dog paperwork to our staff when they arrived, so we essentially had to allow the dog on the property even though we were very disappointed that we were not informed of the dog coming on the property prior to its arrival.  We did speak to the guests more than once to inform them that the dog had to be on a leash at all times while it was on the property.  Usually all service dogs are required to wear their vests while on the property so that other guests recognize that they are service animals.  The owner did not have a vest for the dog at the time so we made the difficult decision to allow the dog even without the vest.        We again feel horrible that the noise level was so great that it caused you to want to leave as soon as possible.  This is obviously not the goal that we have in mind for our guests.  Our number one goal is to have a quiet relaxing atmosphere here and most of the time, we can provide our guests with this type of environment.  However, we failed to do so for you guys.  We definitely have a lot of pride in this business and want it to be successful.  Even if we are booked a lot, we value every customer and would never want people to think that just because we have a high occupancy rate, that we don't need to value our clients as much.  We want everyone that stays here to feel and see that we take pride in our jobs as managers and value everyone's feedback.  In this particular case, we definitely appreciate and value your honest feedback.  We recognize the importance of taking care of our guests and we value every single one of them!        We hope you will give us a chance to redeem ourselves in the future.  We suggest coming back in fall/winter months as the weather is always good here in San Clemente, and there is usually more of a relaxed vibe here than in the summer months.  Hopefully this response provides a little clarity.  This response is not to be viewed as an excuse for what happened because we realize that we need to do a better job as a management team!  Thanks again for staying with us!  Beachcomber Management

Summary Heading: One of the most relaxing places on earth!
Summary: There is not a better spot in San Clemente to enjoy the surf, sand and spectacular sunsets! We loved sitting at the fire pit in the evening and getting to know other guests. Turns out we went to the same high school 45 years ago! The staff couldn't have been more helpful, friendly, or caring!  What a gem! There is no need to try anyplace else down there. Thank you Beachcomber Inn, for a vacation to remember!

Summary Heading: What a view!  And what a dollhouse on the ocean!
Summary: Read the reviews before making my reservation.  OK!  Needed to celebrate my 70th birthday by staying on the ocean!  What a wonderful cozy cabin!  Yes, the cabins are old....but, the owners have steadily been remodeling.  The room w/king size bed was clean.  Cute kitchen.  The bath was extremely small, but clean, and  you can still shower up!  There was even a night light in the bathroom.  As for the view...it was heavenly!!  The sunsets were beautiful.  The pier was just a short walk on a slight downhill.  Two chairs outside your room to sit and just stare at that beautiful ocean!  So glad I came here, and didn't go to some high-rise building on the beach.  The price is very reasonable, considering the prices I looked at other oceanfront hotels of $300+ per night.  I'll

Summary Heading: Lovely place with beautiful views..shame about the weather!
Summary: We arrived for just one night on our So Cal road trip early April and we were so unfortunate as it rained most of the time we were there! How unlucky are we!!   We were checked in by a lovely friendly lady and were given a North Villa.  Our room was gorgeous, very quaint with a small kitchen and adequate bathroom.  As there were 4 of us and the bunk room was not available, we had to utilise the sofa bed.  When there are 4 of you and the sofa bed is opened out...it is an extremely tight squeeze!!! Also the sofa bed had seen better days and the springs were very apparent when you lay on the mattress, so much so, my youngest daughter refused to sleep on it! We had a spare blanket in the room so we lay this over the mattress and my eldest daughter was happy with this.  So guess who

Wow, the location couldn't be better! What a dream. From the min. we booked the management was amazing and so welcoming. It really made the entire experience.  The photos on tripadvisor are not even updated enough, this place is beyond darling and their website is the good place to peek for a better idea. Its' cozy and CLEAN for sure. Can't wait to go back soon.

Summary Heading: Roaring horn blasting commuter & AmTrak trains 24/7
Summary: These old motel cabins are small and are overpriced because of the view.  They are not actually on the beach but on a high hill overlooking the beach.  However, what they don't tell you is that the sound of any waves will be drowned out by the loud horn blasts of Metrolink and AmTrak trains that constantly use the important coastal north-south train line that runs right below your room....literally just feet away. Some overnight freight trains will have you leaping out of a deep sleep as they blast their loud horns at 4am rolling along the track close to your room.. And all day there are countless commuter and passenger trains riding the rails.  Don't be lulled into thinking this is a peaceful l'il oasis on the ocean.

Summary Heading: sweet little inn on the beach!
Summary: We took the train down from LA for my mom's birthday a couple weeks ago and walked right up the hill to this adorable motel overlooking the ocean. Our rooms had the best ocean views of any other place I saw in town and we had our own kitchenettes. The rooms are clean and you can tell have just been remodeled. Really comfortable beds too! We spent a lot of time by the fire pit at night watching the sunset and sitting on the lounge chairs listening to the ocean. I would definitely come back here. The only thing that was a little weird about the place was the note saying they would charge $50 if we left any dirty dishes...

Have been going to San Clemente for many years. Have seen, walked-by and looked up at the Beachcomber from the beach but have never stayed there. My wife and I stayed there for two days for her birthday. A big shame we have not stayed there before, a wonderful place, with spectular views. Now that being said this is an older, up-graded, throw-back motor lodge. If you are looking for an opulent, modern hotel then the Beachcomber will dissapoint you. The Beachcomber rooms are on the small side, with a well appointed kitchenette; a small bathroom, with a small shower; a wonderful king size bed and a little pourch that faced a beautiful ocean and sunset. Large lawn area with chairs, tables and fire ring and a couple modern BBq's (did not use them) that were in use by other guests.

Beautiful Location. If you want great views of the ocean, this is the place to go. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Each room has a small kitchen, sofa, bed and bathroom. Staff is very friendly. You'll enjoy just sitting on your porch watching the surf come in, or roasting marshmallows down at the fire-pit. The San Clemente Pier is a short walk away with a great restaurant and bar. Very low key, relaxing week.

Stayed at the Beachcomber end of January 2016.  They continue to improve the property and the location is awesome.  They have added a six foot diameter gas fireplace overlooking the ocean/pier.  It appeared as if all the rooms have been remodeled/upgraded.  Room 11 is very nice.  Check-in/check-out was a breeze.  The young lady who cleaned our room every day was very nice and efficient.  Overall, the Beachcomber is an excellent choice.  One we will make again.

Almost 5 star.  We LOVED this little piece of California history and will definitely be going back.  When you stay here you are supporting a family run business and you are made to feel very welcome.  We love places that make you feel as if you are stepping back in time.  if you love big hotels with all the bells and whistles, this is not the place for you.  Beachcomber Inn is a vintage style 1940s one story motel that has been renovated and updated making it perfect.  It sits atop the cliff overlooking the San Clemente Pier.  The location is absolute perfection!  The sunsets are amazing from your front porch or you can relax in a chair on the huge lawn.  In the evening enjoy sitting around the gas fire pit.    The rooms are small but adequate, unless you are a very large

Absolute perfection! My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and could not be happier with our stay. The view from the room was unbeatable with plenty of outdoor seating overlooking the beach. Short walk to the pier and beach access, make sure you enjoy the fire pit in the evening. A nice little market with all necessities for your stay within walking distance. Make sure you enjoy a sunset dinner at Fisherman's. We cannot wait to visit again!

I have stayed at the Beachcomber Inn twice and I will definitely be back. Great rooms all with a beautiful view. The bonfire in the evening watching the sunset is an experience that everyone should experience at least once in their life.  The owners are great. So much to do in the area.  Love, love, love it there.

Summary Heading: Fantastic rooms with the perfect view
Summary: My husband and I, along with 2 other couples stayed at the beachcomber and we were pleasantly surprised with the rooms, location, and overall charm of the Inn. Each room was designed with its own theme and had everything you need. Walking out your from door you will find lounge chairs, a large fire pit with chairs, and a beautiful view of the beach and ocean. There are many restaurants, a fun Boardwalk, and even a grocery store near by. Customer service was excellent. Overall, we will definitely come stay here again!

Summary Heading: Unsurpassed enjoyment, will definitely be back!
Summary: My wife and I have stayed at the Beachcomber several times and have never been disappointed. Recent renovations have made our stay even more pleasant. The rooms are very clean, the staff is great and the views are fantastic. Overall an excellent value!

You will not find a better view in Southern California.  I have stayed at several high end hotels and have never had a view as great as what you'll find here.  You are walking distance to pier, local restaurants, and several good surf spots.  You can also sit or play on the green lawn in front of your room and watch the waves, surfers, and train below.  Our kids loved running around on the lawn and watching the trains. (The trains never woke us or our sleeping baby.)  Great place to stay for a couples or family retreat.  You feel like you are at a bed and breakfast or staying with family.  Each bungalow is beautifully decorated.  I was nervous when I learned there was no A/C but the overhead fan and ocean breezes keep you cool.  You can cook your own food in the full kitchen or

Summary Heading: Beautiful views from the Beachcomber Inn's porches
Summary: We have stayed at the Beachcomber Inn three times and have enjoyed it more each time.  They have recently renovated some of the rooms and made them even better.  We recommend making your reservations as early as possible.  Highly recommend.

This place is amazing! From the cute, quaint rooms to the outstanding ocean view, it can't be beat! My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and we loved how quiet and majestic it was! The huge window in our room made the view amazing from wherever you are at. The fire pit at night is also a nice place to relax and enjoy the sound of the crashing waves! Jimmy and Carly who run the motel were so nice and helpful. You will not regret staying here!

Summary Heading: Best So Cal Vacation we've ever done!!!
Summary: We decided to squeeze in one more trip before the kids went back to school.  I had read the reviews and a friend of our recommended this place as one of their favorite So Cal spots.        When we were arrived, we couldn't believe the scenery! It was truly amazing. We felt like we were in Hawaii!!  We were up on top of a bluff overlooking the ocean. Right outside the rooms was a vast grassy area covered with beautiful lounge chairs and tables where you could sit and eat lunch while overlooking the beach. At night our favorite thing to do was to sit by the enormous fire pit and watch the beautiful sunsets.       My favorite thing about the Beachcomber was how quaint the rooms were. It didn't feel like you were at a motel. The kids even called it a "house" at one point. Our room

Summary Heading: Simply the best oceanfront family spot!
Summary: Believe the reviews. The Beachcomber Inn is simply the best choice you can make if you want to treat your family to a real SoCal beach holiday. It's oceanfront looking over the pier. You can watch your kids boogie board for hours, from your deck, at the clean, safe beach. You can relax in your immaculate, bright and cozy room, while watching the waves or sunset through the massive window. Sit by the fire pit at night and meet the other happy guests. The rooms have perfect little kitchens, wifi, and a large TV. San Clemente is a cool, quiet, safe surfer town. Loads of restaurants in walking distance. A big, huge, Canadian thanks to Jimmy for making our stay so awesome. We will be back as soon as we can, and as many times as we can. Honestly, check out San Clemente, it's a real

Summary Heading: stylish rooms, best view in san clemente
Summary: We were staying at the beachcomber for a family wedding and ended up booking nearly the whole hotel. All the rooms were stylish and comfortable. Unbelievably close to the ocean, on a little bluff, what an incredible view and we fell asleep every night to the sounds of the surf! My brother in law hates the heat and he was upset that there was no air conditioning, but it was fine for the rest of us, there's a good breeze from the ocean and two fans in the room.I saw the bad reviews from a few years ago on trip advisor, and I think they must have done a full remodel since then because the rooms are very clean and everything in the bathroom and kitchen seems new. A little slice of heaven!

My sister and I spent a night at the Beachcomber for a quick, much needed breath of fresh ocean air. The view from the huge bay window is the beautiful rolling, crashing waves and clear blue sky. Every time we looked out the door or window we felt like we fell into heaven. The living room is also the bedroom, so the bed is on display in front of the bay window. That is the only slight negative about this lovely place. What it lacks in space, it makes up for in beauty. The tiny kitchen has a nice fridge and stove and there are dishes for your use. The bathroom is itty bitty and its window is next to the busy sidewalk, so that is a little awkward too. Just stay on your private porch in your comfy Adirondack chair and let your worries slip away. The rest is all details.

My wife and I love this place. Clean, big windows facing ocean panoramic, porch, expansive grass, 3 minutes to pier and fun restaurants, clean (small ) rooms, nice pleasant management, lots of upgrades last three years.  We drive from one beach community south of LAX one hour to stay here and get away 😎

Summary Heading: Paradise overlooking the Pacific and the San Clemente Pier...
Summary: We live in San Clemente and walk the beach trail several times a week.  One day we looked up and discovered a hidden gem 10 minutes from our home.  Since discovering this treasure, we have stayed with our 4 children on 3 separate occasions in the past couple months.  The Beachcomber Inn is situated on a grassy bluff overlooking the San Clemente Pier.  Each darling unit has a relaxing porch with excellent views of the white water and the sound of crashing waves.  Even though the hotel has been sold out on each of our visits, we felt like we were at a secluded and private resort.  My children played lawn games, walked down to boogie board, discovered the ice cream shop across the street, roasted marshmallows at the fire pit and even managed to get along as they played card games

Summary Heading: If I could keep it a secret I would but I cannot tell a lie. Very nice place.
Summary: Single story. Two buildings with I believe less than twenty rooms. All done a bit different. All have their own little front porch overlooking the grassy area which overlooks the ocean. When we were there a fire was lit and kept every night. We rented a convertible Camaro to cruise up and down the coast but it sat in the hotels parking lot as we never left except for on foot down to the water or one of the little cafes in the area. This was a wedding anniversary trip and a good one it was. Once again a very nice and relaxing place. Had reservations for a follow up trip but had to cancel. We will be back soon though.

Summary Heading: Quaint little beach hotel with incredible views and access of the San Clemente Pier/Beach
Summary: We live in San Clemente but we decided to spend a week at this great little property and were extremely pleased with it.  It is family run Inn and Jimmy & Carly (the owners) and mom/mother-in-law (Linda) truly made a feel "part of the family."  The rooms are small but nicely renovated.  The bed was very comfortable and each unit has a kitchenette with a full size refrigerator.  The bathroom is quite small but functional enough for us.  There is also a pull-out sofa bed which we never used.    The setting is spectacular; nestled on the bluff just above the San Clemente pier/beach.  The property also has great outside green space with abundant room to spread out and enjoy the days and nights.  The sunset views are fantastic and we gathered around the large fire pit each night to

What a lovely place this is. You can not beat the location and the place is CUTE ! The decor is adorable Spanish style and so comfortable. The kitchen is small but has all you need and NICE pots and pans, good silverware, nice appliances....and everything is spotless. You hear the waves from your comfortable bed. The grounds are fabulous, with ultra comfortable lounge chairs and a huge fire pit. We did not use the BBQ but enjoyed the gorgeous sunset by the fire, laying in the grass....no sand here :)   We stayed in room 10 with our teenage daughter and a friend and it IS a touch cramped for 4, but the location and having all you could possible want at your fingertips, that was easy to deal with. We shall return !!!!!

What a treasure! Our rooms (Suite 11) overlooked the pier and the fire pit on the lawn of the property. It was blissful to be rocked to sleep by the waves hitting the shore at night after a wonderful evening spent sharing stories and beer around the fire! The room was spacious and the bed super-comfortable. A great getaway!

My family and I usually stay in Carlsbad every year but were priced out of our normal spot right on the beach. I've always thought San Clemente looked like a cute place and The Beachcomber always seemed to have rave reviews about their views and I loved the photos online of the updated decor (I'm a decor snob). We arrived on a Monday- check in was quick and easy. We had Unit #2 on the north end of the property. This unit has the least amount of grassy space in front of it but is also very close to the street exit which was very convenient. This unit was very cute inside and very clean. It is TIGHT with 2 kids but having the wonderful porch and multiple places to sit outside around the property makes all the difference. We loved having the huge ocean views. The train was a

Summary Heading: The Only place to stay in San Clemente!
Summary: This is the best place by far to stay in San Clemente. The location is like no other. The owners are nice & accommodating. The beds are new (which is hard to find!) with good support, allowing a great night of sleep. The ownership is over the top. The feel here is like your own little resort. It is very clean. We have stayed other places in the pier area and  were disappointed with the cleanliness and the noise. This place is top notch. The view is unbelievable.

Summary Heading: Very good. Can't be a 5 but very good.
Summary: Nice property. Great views.  Nice mgmt.  Lawn is great. Fire pit great. If it had a pool it would be a 5.  Parking is very tight.  You won't get a truck in.  Rooms are in good shape. Kitchen is small but efficient.  We will go again.

My boyfriend  and I stayed  here and loved every  minute.   We stayed the weekend thru Monday.  They have a few bbq's on site complete  with utensils which was really nice. The kitchens come complete  with pots and pans as well as bowls and anything you would need to cook. We stayed in Unit 6 which had a small coffee  maker, the unit has pre-packaged coffee, but if you want to make your own you will have to bring filters. There is a fire pit, make sure to bring sticks to make smores. All units have a huge ocean view, we sat in our unit and watched a seal play in the waves for a few hours...super relaxing. There are a few places to eat around the pier as well as a small liquor/market within a block. (They have all the fixins to make smores too)  Sundays, del Mar street has a

Summary Heading: Perfect Get away for a great price
Summary: We wanted a get away from the kids and enjoy a relaxing place to stay. This was the perfect find. It gives you everything you want with the service of a small hotel, but with the recent updates to the rooms, it is crazy nice. There is a fire pit that was perfect to sit by and watch the sun set. We walked down to the pier which took 2 minutes and enjoyed some great food near by. We plan on making this a yearly tradition, and I refuse to pay $500 at any nearby hotel, when the Beachcomber is half the price.

This was my 3rd visit over a 20 year period. I've always loved the Beachcomber from the fist time I found it tucked away on the cliff. In years past it was pretty basic and beachy with no particular decorative theme. The draw is the out of this world ocean view. I was so thrilled to see the design updates and physical improvements made. Flat screen TVs, new tiled floors, new windows and AC/heat options. The California style colors and fabrics were cheerful and light but not over the top. The functional but whimsical furniture was a delight. Way to go!! I spent a week in my fantastic corner room and recovered my California vibe. Right on. Loved it as always. Oh yeah-I'll be back. Give it a go.

We enjoyed a "girls weekend B-day trip" in this lovely location. Close to boardwalk, restaurants and lovely San Clemente. Great place to relax, walk the boardwalk, beach and lovely town. WE already look forward to our next stay here!

My family was looking for somewhere to get away for the weekend, relax, and enjoy some time together.  We love the beach, and the Beachcomber Motel seemed like it could be a fun place spend the weekend.  Little did we know how BEAUTIFUL, and enjoyable it would be.  Every room has an AMAZING VIEW of the ocean.  Our room was so nicely decorated, and was very comfortable & clean.  It was awesome to have the kitchenette while staying with our kids.  Everyone was so friendly and helpful.  We had such a great weekend together.  Our kids keep thanking us for taking them there!  hahaha  We can't wait to go back and take our whole family...older children & grandchildren.  It will be one of our family favorites in the future for sure

First of all let me just say how gorgeous this place is! I absolutely loved staying here! It's so original.. Definitely nothing like a chain hotel.  The customer service here is outstanding, super welcoming & friendly! The views here are phenomenal! My favorite part is definitely sitting next to the firepit while hearing the waves.. Such a wonderful place!

We had such a nice time. Your rooms were perfect for our family. The kids bunk beds and the full kitchen were a total hit for us! The price was very fair. We were able to cook full meals in the room. The beds were so comfortable. It was the view and fire pit and night that we loved the most. We will be back! Anyone looking for beach front in Southern California kind of boutique style, totally updated rooms with kitchens, next to the San Clemente Pier, you should stay here!

Perfect Beach Getaway!   My husband and I were thrilled we found the best kept secret in San Clemente-  The BeachComber Inn!  It is the perfect getaway, a place to relax, unwind, and rejuvenate!  This Beautiful Oceanfront Inn has Breathtaking views and is just steps away from the San Clemente Pier and Beach, and tasty Restaurants.  We fell in love with the Gorgeous, Clean, Updated, and Tastefully decorated rooms.  We stayed in a villa #3 that had a super comfortable king size bed, sofa (w/pull out bed), table and chairs, big screen tv, bath, and a full kitchen (gas stove,full size fridge, sink, hand made tile counters, pots, pans, plates, bowls, cups and silverware).  Everything we needed and more!  My husband is training for a new job and we are so grateful we stumbled upon the

Summary Heading: Wow! The place has been completely renovated.
Summary: Wow. The place has been completely renovated. We've stayed at the Beachcomber for many years. The new management has turned this ocean front classic into something great. All the rooms have been redone, including new mattresses. Best you order a small rental car. Parking is tight. Free parking and fast internet Well done Beachcomber! We'll be back!!

My wife and I were fortunate to be able to stay at this gem on the ocean. This is not your typical motel. The rooms are small but very pleasant. Every room has a picture window overlooking the ocean. The deck with comfy deck chairs is perfect for relaxing with a glass of wine. The sunsets are awesome and everything is within walking distance. If you are fortunate enough to be able to get a room here, don't hesitate, grab it. You won't be sorry!

We stayed here three nights in December 2014 and it was wonderful and the view is stunning!  When making the reservations, spoke with the manager and told him my husband uses a walker and asked about room accessibility.  He was very kind and booked us in the room that was closest to the parking lot.  My husband literally only had to take a few steps to get to the room and                              even though there were stairs leading to the room, it was surprisingly accessible for him.  The room was lovely and we will definitely return.  We appreciated the considerate service most of all.

We just loved our room here, we could hardly leave the place to do anything. The view from the porch (really the entire property), the lounge chairs in the green lawn, the fire pit, it was great. Management was very good, the room clean. Each room with a huge window to the ocean, well stocked kitchen, big comfy bed. The pier is right there as well as great restaurants very nearby or a short walk to the downtown area. People had mentioned the train in reviews but honestly it was part of the scene here, not at all intrusive, we slept very well. If we plan a trip to San Clemente again we will try to book here for sure.

The Beachcomber has been here forever and thus is not a formulaic cookie cutter kind of place. It has character, good management and good maintenance! Book early book often! You won't regret it. Yes, the train runs past several times per day, but the noise only lasts a minute.

BEST place to stay in San Clemente! I can't wait to come back! Killer views, clean/updated cute rooms, nice staff, steps to beach and you can walk to bars, restaurants and a yoga studio (if you're into yoga, check out Asana Fit). Plus, they have kitchens in the rooms and grills onsite, a fire pit to chill and a beautifully manicured lawn to relax on and watch the surfers. LOVE this place so much!! Tip: Book early and try to stay during the week ;)

We stayed for 3 nights in late September as part of our San Diego honeymoon and would have extended our stay at the Beachcomber if they were not fully booked.  We loved the view that each cottage had, the adirondack chairs in front of our room and an easy walk to great restaurants and the beach.  There is a dirt trail that runs for 1.5 miles in each direction, directly parallel to the beach that we loved walking each day. The sunsets could not be beat.  Had crepe breakfasts across the street and great jalapeno margaritas at South of Nicks in town.  The train came by close to the hotel several times during the day and night but it did not bother either of us.  Light sleepers might want to bring earplugs.

This was the BEST family vacation we could ask for! The Beachcomber was absolutely perfect! The views you see in their photos on their website are REAL! The set up is so unique- everyone has their own front porch with the same gorgeous ocean views and then there is a sprawling lawn overlooking the ocean with charming thatched umbrellas and lounge chairs, tables, a firepit (They light it every night for you!) and even two high end grills! We didn't need to leave grounds- we would order pizza or grill and hang out enjoying the ocean! The 5 minute walk down to the pier is easy and there is a lot to choose from near the pier:restaurant, bar, café with great coffee and breakfast/lunch, icecream, etc! We will 100% stay at The Beachcomber every time we visit!! They are very personable

Summary Heading: One of my all time favorites.
Summary: My wife and I were traveling down to San Diego and just happened to run across this place. I have no idea how we found it, but it was spectacular! The room was kind of old and quiant?, but the view of the ocean,the sound of the waves crashing, the train tracks right below the bluff, the restaurant on the pier with their calamari STEAK and Huge Prawns more than made up for it!  As we did not have a reservation, we were happy that they had a cancellation and I was able to negotiate a very reasonable cash rate.  The lawn in the front of the room was very lush and we were able to sit outside in the chairs around the fire pit and watch an amazing sunset. It was perfect...:) I would absolutely return to this wonderful place.  It is really one of my all time favorite places my wife and

I came here with 3 of my friends for my 18th birthday, and when we arrived we found out that I had booked The Beachcomber Motel in Fort Braggs instead of San Clemente, so word of advice, make sure you're booking the right one! Luckily they had a cancellation so we were able to stay there after all, and I'm really glad we did. The room was really cutely decorated and it had a huge window that you could see the ocean and pier from. There was a very small kitchen (still had sink, oven, stove, and fridge/freezer though) and although the bathroom was small, it was very nice. The owners were really nice and accommodating, and the grounds had all these picnic tables and Adirondacks and chaise lounges that looked out over the ocean, and a fire pit as well. The only tiny issue we had was

My wife, daughter (almost 17) and I have been vacationing here for the last 10+  years. Most recently, we stayed two nights w/o July 18 and three nights w/o July 25. The view and setting are spectacular and that's always been the draw. The accommodations have, until this summer, been lacking. Often described as 'quirky' or 'funky' in past reviews, these were just euphemisms for 'barely acceptable'. That's now changed.   The new managers (Jimmy and Carly) have essentially gutted the rooms and refurbished them with: new tile (replacing a disgusting carpet), new king-sized beds, new stoves, new furniture, new showers, room safes, new Adirondack chairs for the porch, new grills (guests share), etc. The clientele has also changed: much more family/couple centered than in the past

Summary Heading: Excellent, but imperfect, place to enjoy the ocean
Summary: Above all, you are close enough to the ocean to hear the waves while enjoying exceptional views from any room and the motel’s center lawn. You can admire a great view from your bed, from the Adirondack chairs on the porch, and from the lawn chairs and lounges. Few places in Southern California do this as well.  Close to the ocean in San Clemente means close to the train tracks. There’s at least one train per hour during the day and a few after 10 pm, each with a loud whistle.  The studios are extra small motel rooms, but they include small, fully functional kitchens. The bathroom is very small, with little space for toiletries. I was told that the one bedrooms are about 100 sq ft larger than the studios. While the view from the room dazzles, people walking by can look into your

Loved this little motel by the ocean. It was a bit on the pricey side due to high season, so we could only stay one night, but it was worth it. The view is amazing, the stay is relaxing. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Great great place. Train is just part of the background noise.

This hotel was awesome!  Very clean, great customer service and a beautiful view of the ocean and pier. For guests that have a larger vehicle, parking is very, very tight. All rooms have an ocean view, chairs on the porch as well as lounge chairs in the yard.

Enjoyed our visit from check in to check out. We got there a little early and was still able to get into our room... Then on to boogie board at the beach below (we brought our own beach toys) and then dinner at the pier. . The nearby train was not a problem at all during the night,  never even heard it after 10pm or before 8am. Woke up to a lovely view from our front porch.  Sat on the front porch and enjoyed a take out breakfast from a local cafe.  Wonderful quiet getaway

Summary Heading: Everything we hoped for, except for that Amtrak & Coastalliner train running through!
Summary: Our dear friend, who is a true beach lover, recommended this hotel on our way from LA to San Diego-his description: funky, great location, truly "motel no-tell" type accommodations! Frankly, this would NEVER be my stop if not for our friend! Well, the Beachcomber more than met our expectations for location, view, proximity! Old fashioned motel - concrete block outside, little adorable porches, rooms newly renovated - with bright, tropical colors. Bathroom & kitchen were teeny tiny, no telephones in the room, but a huge, flat screen TV - go figure!!!! This would definitely be a 5 "dot" rating, if not for the bizarre running of the train, Amtrak & Coastal Liner, on the tracks between the Beachcomber & the beach proper. Apparently, this track runs the entire length of beach between

Twelve single story units ocean front on a bluff overlooking one of the most picturesque beaches you'll ever see. White stucco and red tiled roofs. It doesn't get more "San Clemente" than this. Newly remodeled, the entire property is perfection. You will never want want to leave, but if you must, everything is close by. Sunset views over the pier are amazing and the huge gas fire pit afterward make the most of every evening. The buildings and grounds seem to be unchanged from 1948 and that is a good thing. They are well kept, completely updated and very comfortable. So, so cool. The location and views are beyond ideal. Lots of places are nice, but this place is more than a room, it's a unique and special experience.

Beachcomber Motel in San Clemente is a charming motel set on a cliff overlooking the San Clemente Pier and Beach.  We have stayed at beachfront locations for decades and this has the finest view you could ask for.  The motel (my wife had never stayed at a motel before) has been recently renovated and could be described better as a beach cottage.  The room itself is decorated in beach colors with a huge king size bed, a small bathroom and small kitchen that is fully equipped and stocked.  Outside the room is a porch with chairs and a table perfect for morning coffee or evening sunsets.  The sun sets spectacularly over the San Clemente Pier, Dana Pt. Harbor and Catalina Island.  The motel features two Bar-b-ques, picknick tables and lounge chairs on an expansive lawn area

Summary Heading: Funky and Wonderful in San Clemente
Summary: We had originally booked the Hampton Inn for a quick overnight in San Clemente when my daughter-in-law's mother sent an email about the Beachcomber. She and her husband are planning a trip to Southern California in a couple of months, and their friend, a self-proclaimed "beach aficionado" said they MUST stay at the Beachcomber.  While we trust the reliable Hampton Inn when we're on the road, we decided to take the tip and book a room at the Beachcomber.  Since we knew we would be arriving after hours (the office close at 6PM), we were given explicit instructions about where to find our key, the WiFi password, etc.  We arrived at the far end of dusk but could immediately tell we would love this place.  First of all, the setting is spectacular!  It's not across from the ocean,

Last minute booking, very accommodating. On the side of the hill coming away from the pier, it's an updated old-style motel. Grounds are great, plenty of places to sit and relax. Rooms appear to have been updated recently, they are retro-cool. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Nice clean modern bathroom. Handy addition of a little kitchenette w/ fridge, microwave etc. However, the undoubted selling point is the view. Looking down from the hill onto the beach and the pier, facing in the direction of the sunset over the ocean, each of the rooms has MASSIVE picture windows, which while can leave you a little exposed to other guests walking by, are stunning features to wake up to. Comfy chairs outside each unit to ponder life while watching the surfers.

You can't beat the view, and the rooms (we had # 5 & 6) have all been redecorated and are very comfortable in all ways.  The hosts were friendly, helpful and very interested to make our stay enjoyable.  Location to pier, restaurants & the village make it ideal.  We'll be back & will bring more friends & family!  Loved hearing the trains go by.

Quaint small units each with its porch overlooking San Clemente pier, Pacific sunsets and a large private grassy yard for guests' use. Amtrak stops nearby.  Enjoy the ocean from the train en route, and even more from your porch.  Absolutely Unique!

We love to spend special occasions at the Beachcomber. It is nothing fancy but it has all the necessities you could need. The showers are a little small but when you get a unit with the full kitchen, it's convenience at it's best. We live only 30 minutes from here so we like to bring most of our food and lots of snacks.  That way we don't have to leave the grassy hill all weekend if we don't want to and quite often we have visitors to entertain. Everyone loves it! Seems that every time we visit they have upgraded something and management is very friendly and accommodating. Best sleep ever with the sound of the surf right out your door.

Just got back from my mini vacation in San Clemente. I staid at the Beachcomber Motel and I feel like I have been gone long time. It was wonderful, very relaxing, loved my room, Nr. 10. The view is outstanding, very quiet, all I could hear was the ocean sound and sometimes the train, which I love. The room was lovely, updated nicely, very comfy bed. I will definitely come back here. Miss it already. Ursula

Absolutely stunning location.  The views to the Ocean are exquisite.  The room was large and very comfortable with well equipped kitchen (fridge AND freezer) and bathroom with good shower. Patio seats let you sit and gaze over the ocean watching surfers and the beach. The Amtrack Surfliner runs between the rooms and the beach but it is below eye level and more of a bonus than a problem.  The reception lady was very helpful and friendly and we would definitely go back.

Summary Heading: Our third time here! Still love it!
Summary: You simply cannot find a better view of the ocean in San Clemente! Beautiful grass, tables chairs bbqs, thatch covered picnic tables, and the ocean just 75 feet away and down about 25-30 feet. Simply paradise!  Hotel is undergoing renovations. Only problem is the bathroom (especially the sink and shower) are small.) but for that one small detail, this place is a bit of Heaven on Earth! Staff is friendly, beds comfy, newer TV's installed, but it's all about the view, the view, THE VIEW! and the sound of the surf crashing on the beach below....Lot's of restaurants nearby, too!

Motels are not usually the place i want to make a destination.  It is more of a pit stop.  This one is adorable however!  The old Spanish Style is charming and the rooms, while dated to the 50's are clean and fresh.  As you sit on the lawn (that is on a bluff) or right from your room the view of the ocean and pier is the real attraction here.  Views really dont get better than this.   The rates are decent and the management is very good.  The train can be loud and runs directly by at the bottom of the bluff.  A little grocery/liquor store and places to eat dot the pier bowl area.  This place was in danger of being destroyed in the 90's when a large developer wanted to replace it with a huge hotel.  San Clemente fought this to save this small and beloved relic of our coast!

What an amazing place to go to get away from life for a while.....amazing ocean view with the quite needed to recoup.  Great lawn space for the family to throw a football around.  Fire pits for night talking ..quality time with family....the management is very kind and helpful....and my favorite part....falling a sleep to the sound of the ocean crashing against the sand....a great place!

Ok, this is not a resort, a timeshare rental, or a hotel.  As the name suggests, it is a motel and if you going in knowing that, you won't get any surprises.  The manager is very nice.  The views are excellent.  I don't think you could get a better/closer view.   The train noise is not too bad (if you think the train noise will bother you perhaps stay at one of the 100 other beaches in So. Cal with no trains).  I thought the train was part of the flavor of San Clemente.  It is a 5 minute walk to the beach (there is a hill involved and if you had mobility issues, this could be an issue).  We stayed in unit # 5 and can only agree with other reviews that the unit needs upgrading, but the manager is currently working on renovations.  There was really no comfortable place to sit in

Summary Heading: Beautiful spot, priced right, great management!
Summary: Perfect spot for a quiet get away with gorgeous views! We loved having all the great aspects of the beach without the crowds, seagulls, and sand haha. The husband and wife managers went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay and had everything we needed. Customer service like that is hard to come by and goes a long way. We already booked a room for next year and plan on another trip in the summer. This is our new go to spot!

Summary Heading: Our Second time here and more visits to come!
Summary: We stayed here last year (March 30th, 2012) and loved it back then. On April 3rd we rented two units (#8 and #9) and our son and his wife and our baby grandson stayed in #9 and our 7 year old granddaughter stayed with us in #8.  My son and his wife LOVED this place!  In fact, we hope to do it again next year. They live near Pittsburgh, PA, but loved the views, the grass, the palm trees below, more like Hawaii then most other So Cal beaches.  Motel was clean, beds comfortable. They now have new wide screen TV's, and are always improving this property that dates form the 1940's. This place has lots of charm, comfortable chairs on the deck overlooking the beach and ocean just below. My one and only complaint and it cannot be fixed, is the smallness of the bathroom, but everything

Summary Heading: Our friends thought we escaped to Hawaii!
Summary: Husband's perspective  My wife and I decided to have a weekend get away for our anniversary and we happened upon this romantic quaint gem.  Located overlooking San Clemente Pier it has incredible views to sip a cold one watching the setting sun.  Then when the sun goes down, the new managers and staff provided a small bonfire to sit and enjoy evening. You awake to the same amazing views in the morning with pleasant breezes and coastal life floods your veins.   At every step of the way the staff was super accommodating.  For me this paradise was ideal because we were located a walk to the beach for my morning surf, the rooms were very clean with stoves and refrigerators.  We were a stone's throw away for the pier front restaurants or a reasonable uphill walk to downtown San

We stayed here the first time on April 5, 2013.  The property was clearly built in the 40's and shows it age.  To me, that's a blessing not a curse.  I spend way too much time in Marriotts, Hiltons and the like when I travel for business so I'm not looking for or expecting that type of homogeneous lodging.  Here is what I think.  The furniture is retro but clean and in good shape.  The shower has plenty of hot water with good water pressure.  The bed was fine as I slept well.   Did not hear the train after 11 p.m.  That's the "bad".    Now the good -- this place has an absolutely stunning view of the ocean and San Clemente pier.  There is a wonderful rear lawn area that runs the entire length of the property with chairs so that you can sit with a couple of Coronas as the sun

We stayed here March 15-17th, 2013 for the weekend and absolutely loved everything about it, the only thing we didn't like was that we had to go home and back to the real world.  The room was great, it was super clean, the new managers were wonderful and very accomodating, in fact, we had a few friends show up and they had forgot their pump to their air mattress, so instead of blowing up the air mattress with our mouths, haha.  The manager "Jimmy" provided us with a brand new air mattress to use. Each night we sat by the fire that they had started for us.  The room had a living room, seperate bedroom, full kitchen, and bathroom, we spent most of the time outside, enjoying the view and taking in the fresh air.  We slept with the windows open, and didn't hear the train like others

Ah, the Beachcomber. I've wanted to stay there for years, and just fulfilled that dream. I went there alone to rejuvenate, and there are definite pros and cons: PROS: - The view of the Pacific Ocean is spectacular, and the main reason to stay there.  - The property is beautifully maintained on exterior, with an expansive, greeen lawn, fresh paint on the buildings, lovely landscaping. - Each room has a pretty porch with comfie Adirondack chairs, and again, that view. - There are kitchens in every room, with full-size fridge, microwave, range, dishes, pots & pans. They are circa 1950, and not fancy, however. - The price is reasonable. - There are several cafes and restaurants in walking distance, as well as a little mini mart where you can pick up snacks, wine, etc. - The room was

the negatives ....   drafty ....   and the ability to get hot water was a problem.  very fuzzy tV  very erratic Wifi  The positives..     view.....   daily maid service.....   kitchen........   there is not restaurant and I can not erase it..    needs a place to submit non applicable

For years I have wanted to stay at the Beachcomber Motel in San Clemente and it has always been full and this time we were able to get a room and it was worth waiting for.  I love having a room that is more than a room - it is more like a small cabin with a kitchen.  I love waking up and going to sleep with the sound of the ocean.  I love stepping out of my door and sitting on my veranda watching the ocean, the sunrise and sunset.  Part of me wants to keep this place to myself and yet I am only in San Clemente once a year so I am overriding that and advising you to book well ahead of time.  So the location and type of accommodations are my type of place.  My daughter on the other hand is willing to live with a road in between her and the ocean so she can stay in a fancy much

You know, if you cant tell what kind of "experience" you're going to have staying at this motel by just looking at it you dont deserve to share the small joys of life with the rest of us. We really dont want you around. Really? The train bothered you? Get over yourself and lighten up. The train is just a small part of what makes staying here enjoyable. I just WISH i would have run into the Innkeeper after having a couple...hopefully would have convinced him to have a couple more while listening to what I can only imagine would have been some of the most interesting stories heard in some time.  My wife and I stumbled upon this place while driving up the coast looking for a little hotel on the beach that didn't look like every other hotel in every other town. As soon as we saw it

We recently stayed at the beachcomber motel, what you are paying for is the view. The motel overlooks the pier and beach, so you get a great view from outside your room. The motel is very dated and in need of an upgrade, there are signs saying that renovations are taking place, but they look like they might have been there a while. There was a large flat screen TV in our room, but the rest of the furniture and décor is quite old. There are 12 rooms, 1 through 6 back onto the street, 7 through 12 back onto an adjacent property, so 7 through 12 will be quieter. But that is relative, as mentioned in other reviews the train tracks run between the motel and beach. Trains seem to run quite often and as there is a crossing at the pier, blow their horns as a warning. There are a few
Manager Response: The Beachcomber Motel is a 1940 Vintage style motel.  The upgrades are being done as we speak.  Actually, the signs we put in the rooms were put up about a month or two before you got here and will continue to be there until after next winter when everything should be completed.  It’s not easy to work in the rooms during the summer, plus it just wouldn’t be right during the peak season.  Probably about 99% of our guests are good with the train.  It adds to the ambiance of the pier bowl area.  I think the conductor is pretty cool because when he toots his horn when I am lying back, he always seem to do it in the right way.  It also is very convenient for our guests who take the train to come here.  They can get off right at the pier, walk up to the motel, and not worry about having to drive around anywhere.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary Heading: The view is stunning - Just don't turn around
Summary: Warning - there is a train that runs every 40 minutes all night with a blaring horn. Warning - there is a train that runs every 40 minutes all night with a blaring horn. Warning - there is a train that runs every 40 minutes all night with a blaring horn.  Beautiful location with a beautiful view but the long term owners / management have let the place fall into a state of aged disrepair with kludged fixes here and there.  Not to blame them though it is a really old property that shows it's age.  The only real remedy is to tear it down.  We could only force ourselves to stay one night but as it was so bad.  One must pay in advance and so we choose to leave and forfeit one nights rate (170USD) and find somewhere else to stay - thank god for hotel points I had elsewhere.  One thing
Manager Response: As you could see when you were here, the motel was being worked on.  It should have been obvious that there were many, many projects going on.  As for the train, 99% of the people that come here are fine with seeing the train come around the bend.  I really feel that the conductor is considerate at night by usually just tooting his horn in a nice way.  In the day, because of all the people at the pier around the crossing, it gets a little louder.
