I did talk to the conductor and he said that it is the law that they have to blow the horn at a certain point.  As far as the shower, I am proud of our showers.  Like everything else we try hard to keep things in the original style, which is important to us.  Among many other things, we just added shower doors which do enhance the showers.  Different people prefer different types of hotels or motels.  Some would rather stay at a chain or a business class hotel, or something like the Ritz Carlton.  This is a historical, 1940 Spanish style motel, and people who stay here realize that and love the way it is.  Yes, we probably did have a nice chat, as I do with many people.  I live here and sometimes enjoy a glass of wine and a fine cigar.  If you would have mentioned that you like that sort of thing, I probably would have shared with you during our conversation.  At that time, we could have talked about all of your complaints, instead of letting me know on Trip Advisor.  We take all complaints seriously, and try our best to keep our customers happy.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary: My boyfriend and I love this place!  The fantastic unobstructed ocean views from the huge picture window in the room, the beautifully mantained green grassy area with seating overlooking the beach, and the patio area with seating right outside the room are just three features making the Beachcomber such a special find.  We also love the  fully equipped vintage kitchen and the vintage tile in the shower which reminded me of my grandmothers place in 1960's LA.  The location couldn't be any better as it's a nice walk to the beach, the pier, great restaurants and shopping.  The sofa and chairs needed to be replaced, as well as the vanity in the bathroom, and parking is tight and limited; however, these negatives won't keep us from looking forward to a return trip!

Almost 5 years after our first visit we returned for a 5 day stay in September 2011.  Still the knock out view and we LOVE coming to SoCal from Chicago for R&R.  Relatively quiet and peaceful location gave us time to recharge our batteries.  But, sadly, nothing has been improved since our last visit.  The rooms are very dated, bathroom was barely adequate (think KOA campground), furniture ready for the landfill.  Overall, we were disappointed that the innkeepers haven't put anything into the property to keep it fresh and welcoming.  It's not a cheap stay, either.  Might still return in another 5 years but we can no longer give this little motel an enthusiastic thumbs up.
Manager Response: We understand your concern totally and would like to say two things about this review (also it should cover other reviews as well).  As much as we wanted to, we couldn’t put hardly any money into the motel for 3 full years, and believe us, that bothered us more than you will ever know.  It was out of our control.  Upgrades are being done now (but still keeping with the historical flavor of the motel), and we feel good about what we are doing.  We think you would agree.  Come see.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary Heading: Really wish I could give a better review!
Summary: We stayed here for our anniversary for 2 nights in January 2012. The reason I have waited so long to give a review is because I couldn't think of a good way to voice my opinions. This is a fabulous property and has so much potential, but I can't give a good rating just for the view. I love quaint and old, but there is a limit to what I consider livable. The views are fantastic, and the grounds are kept up nicely. I thought the rate was fine for off-season, but high season was higher than I would pay for this hotel. The rooms leave quite a bit to be desired. The carpets are very dirty, but the rest of the room is as clean as can be expected, though really worn. (The bedspread is extremely used and faded, the fan blades were actually worn down to the cardboard, which gave us a
Manager Response: Just to let you know, unfortunately, you got here right before we started a restoration of the motel.  You are right that some things needed to be done.  There were reasons beyond our control that prohibited us from completing the upgrades we wanted to for a period of time, but we started them in February of this year and are still doing them (except for during the summer so we don’t inconvenience our guests).   If you had come a year later, we are sure that your review would have been completely different.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary: The Beachcomber Motel is an older small motel but it sits on a cliff overlooking the Pacific and has the best view in San Clemente.  They were in the process of doing upgrades on the rooms, while trying to keep the quaint integrity of the property.  If you like ultra modern with all the bells and whistles, this is not your place.  We spent only one day here, but sat in the lounges on the beautifully kept grounds and watched the surfers, dolphins playing just off shore and multitudes of various birds.  They have a table on the lawn to play checkers (with colored sea shells), a gas grill if you want to cook something, and several areas of seating to view the sunset.  The staff were all very friendly and the room was clean, the kitchen well supplies with utensils.  The bathroom was

The view is the best in San Clemente! the staff was friendly and attentive. We just stayed there last night (3/29/2012) in room #4, a studio. The room was nicely furnished. The furniture was a bit worn, the bathroom a bit small, BUT, overall, it was very comfy, excellent view from the front patio as well as from inside. This place has everything, nice chairs out on the lawn, a barbecue, a fully equipped kitchen. We got the room at a special price, a lot less than you would expect to pay for a full ocean front property in So Cal.... We'll be back!

Summary Heading: Location can't get any better, rooms not so good
Summary: The location of this place is just beautiful, the grounds were keep very well. But it stoped there, our room was disgusting #8. It really needs updating. Bathroom very small,not a shelf in shower or out side in bathroom, no where to put your stuff. Our blanket on bed had rips in them, the couch was dirty and felt it. The rug was SO dirty, you couldn't go barefoot. It really was a shame because you look out your window and all you see is ocean, and the sunset. As much as I liked the setting, I don't know if I would go back and stay there. If your at all fussy, it's not the place for you.
Manager Response: Sorry we didn’t respond sooner, but we now are doing many upgrades, being careful not to disrupt the historical feeling of the motel.  We will add more shelves in the bathroom as we go through the rooms.   The problem was that we couldn’t put carpets in and many other things we wanted to do (for quite some time) for reasons out of our control.  Since them many floor coverings have been replaced along with many other improvements.  Things are definitely getting better now.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary: Such a peaceful place to stay.  The rooms are just okay but I'm sitting on the porch looking out over the ocean and too relaxed and at peace to care about much of anything.  Life is good.

Summary Heading: I can't imagine why anyone would give this place anything less than at least 4 stars!
Summary: For me, it doesn't really get much better than this.  You can have your W hotels (and I've stayed at plenty of those too), this place will always seem like a little piece of heaven to my wife and I.  Stayed here last summer, quite by accident after ending our stay at Disneyland and finding our next location (with a friend in LA) cancelled due to illness.  Thus we treked down the coast just seeing what we could find and came across this place.  AMAZING views of the beach and ocean, friendly owners and a very well maintained a clean classic-looking motel from decades past.  Full kitchen, comfortable beds and a community BBQ grill that was first-come first served.  Thus I hit the Trader Joes nearby for our dinner fixings and grilled some steaks while the kids played and watched the

This hotel just missed out on our “ best hotel of the holiday “  award  only because we paid for what we got , and what we got was a chalet with not just A view , but THE  VIEW of our three week Californian vaction.  The service here was great too , beach towels on demand , free WIFI  , big fridge and the owner’s son ( I think )  lit the fire pit every evening we were there .  The sunsets over the ocean  both nights were spectacular  , our second evening , we got a pizza and a bottle of wine and sat at the picnic bench outside our door and watched the sun go down . As we were handing the car back the next again day , this made the perfect end of a perfect road trip . I would highly recommend staying here , it is well worth the cost .

My goodness what a location!  My family (including two small children) enjoyed two nights here recently.  It's a quick walk to the beach and town and enjoys the most beautiful hilltop location you could ask for.  Each night we enjoyed the firepit and grassy area outside our room.  The room itself isn't much, but it does have a full kitchen.  The bed was comfortable, but the sleeper sofa is what you would expect, springs!  There were plenty of drawers for our clothes and the shower though small, had nice water pressure and was perfect for showering a 5 and 3 year old.    This is not a luxury vacation, if you know that going in, you will be just fine.  The property is a motel, remember.  It IS a laid back beach vacation.  The owners were very accomodating and friendly.  We had a

Summary Heading: If you want to watch the sunset in a paciifc coast motel then stay here!
Summary: Best location we have stayed in for sunset and pacific coast. Its a motel so it was never 5* but its location is great. Compared to others we have stayed in this one was a little bit pricey. We didnt know about the railway line at the end of the garden but it was OK. The location makes this hotel and it was so good we stayed an extra night. The owners were helpful if a little shy! Free parking & Wi Fi was useful.With a kitchen and outdoor bar-b-q meant we could save by cooking in.  But that beach, and those views of the Pacific and the sunsets make this hotel a great stay.

The location and view was perfect. Outside was nice with great grassy area. The outside of the hotel was cute and had easy parking. The inside was not nice at all. They really need to redecorate. Not happy with the room. It's too bad because it could be the perfect hotel.
Manager Response: We are sorry we didn’t respond sooner.  As we had mentioned in other responses, there was a period of time where, beyond our control, we were unable to complete the upgrades we knew needed to be done.  As of this February, we started doing upgrades and are still in the process of doing them.  We hope you will come back and see what we have done.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary Heading: A Wonderful Treasure with Friendly Service
Summary: I hesitate to write a good review for the Beachcomber only because I want to keep the secret for myself!!  This motel is an incredible value for the location and friendly service of the owners who live on property and are there to take care of your every need.  Funky yes, but that is the charm and beauty of this special place.  We have our out of town friends stay only here.  We had a birthday party for a friend on their lawn overlooking the ocean and pier.  You can't find a better location and value.

Summary Heading: Holy Crap - some of these reviews!  This is a beautiful ocean view, reasonable prices!
Summary: We have been here 3 times.  If you want a luxury hotel, then yes, maybe you need to try somewhere else.  If you want to sit on the porch with a drink and watch the sunset over the ocean, sleep comfortably, then go for a walk in the morning along the beach.....all at a reasonable price, then this is a pretty good place to be.  Just determine your priorities before, and consider what you want to pay.  Personally, this is perfect for us and why we keep coming back.  Perfect?  No.  When I am a millionaire, I might look for perfect.  But I may just come right back to the Beachcomber, anyway.  It is peaceful and simple.  What else do you really need?

The Beachcomber Motel offers you the most awesome views of the San Clemente Beach and pier.  The folks at the motel are friendly and same with their staff.  The rooms are dated but quaint.  If you are not expecting anything modern, this is the place.  They offer a small bathroom, kitchen, living/bedroom, and a bay window with a fantastic view of the ocean.  Listening to the waves crashing at night was a plus and so was the passing of the train every so often.  Some may find the RR annoying, but I thought it added to the whole atmosphere.  Each room has its own private veranda where you can sit and watch the sunrise or the breathtaking sunsets.

Summary Heading: Slept like a baby in this prime location
Summary: Lovely small and simple motel on the beach.  Value in the peaceful rhythms of the surf and train whistle.  Had a relaxing get away with walks on the beach, drinks with a view, sunsets to die for, walks to restaurant for dinner and even cooked dinner in one night - kitchen is small but functional.  Took the train from San Diego - loved ditching the car for the weekend.

My brother lives in So Cal and loves this place, so we went on his recommendation. The grounds are beautiful, and the scenery can't be beat. But the rooms are not acceptable. When we got there, the managers were less than helpful, as a matter of fact seemed annoyed with having to deal with guests. The rooms are old, I understand that, but the place was dirty. Dirty shag carpet, dirty refrigerator/freezer, and the bed was so hard my arms went to sleep. The sink in the bathroom was leaking, the shower was cracked and broken, and they used the same room-temperature sponge to clean the dishes from guest to guest. We asked for another room, and they said we could stay a couple of doors down, but only for a couple of nights, as they had rented 4 rooms out to some other people. We
Manager Response: I don’t know how you can say that the managers aren’t helpful and don’t care about their guests.  We are very proud of our customers and we have many many regulars who would agree that our entire family is known to be very friendly.  I wish I knew exactly why you said that.  Yes, the place is old.  It is about 70 years old, but most people think that it is kept up very well considering its age.  We try to keep up on buffing the carpets as needed.  None of the carpets are stained, but if you think the carpet wasn’t clean, we are sorry.  We check them every Friday and do them as needed.  Also, our housekeepers let us know if any of them are dirty.  I am sure the refrigerator and freezer weren’t dirty.  Benita and Marta always do a great job on cleaning.  It was probably some rust on the refrigerator.  That happens because we are so close to the ocean and things like refrigerators rust quickly.  We change them out from time to time.  You were the first person who complained about that bed.  We are sorry if you think it was uncomfortable.    I cannot remember about the leak but when some plumbing is leaking, we automatically fix it right away.  We have had the same plumber for 20 years.  I think the shower is ok.  Yes, you asked for another room and if we could have we would have accommodated you the way you wanted, but before you reserved, we did have a family who reserved 4 rooms together.  We did not want to break them up.  I think most people would understand that.  We were able to give you a different room for all the remaining days of your reservation except for the last night (which is when the family came in).  Most everyone thinks this place is kept up well considering it gets used very hard especially during the summer.   September, to us and many of our customers, is still considered summer.  It is a very busy month.  There is hair and body wash in the dispenser in all the showers.  No, there aren’t hair dryers in the rooms, but we do provide them on request, as we do with irons and ironing boards.  We also provide beach towels, boogie boards, and almost anything else you need to borrow for the beach.  We try to accommodate our guests the best we can.  John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary: The most unique place with the best view around. It's one of the few original motels. Beautiful flowers and cacti, nice fire pit, grill, picnic table, and seating. Owners on site. Could not get connect with their Internet in rooms.

We went on a surf trip with 3 adults and 2 teens. We were assured there would be plenty of room for all of us to sleep. When we first got there the toilet handle fell off on the floor. The plastic chair on the deck broke on the back from a regular weight adult. The kids checked the fold out couch and the springs were loose right when it opened up. No way could anyone sleep on it.  The bedspreads or carpeting did not appear clean and fresh. The shower backed up so after a regular short shower it was backed up with a few inches of dirty water. The kitchen and bathroom were both very small and the kitchen dishes were dirty. The bunkbed room was super small and there were no screens on the windows for fresh air (without bugs), The door in the bunk room was very difficult to lock or
Manager Response: Yes, since we entered in on the California water conservation program and acquired new toilets in the entire motel, the only problem we experienced was that the handles were defective and fell off sometimes.  We changed them out when they break.  We are sorry that the PVC chair on the porch broke.  We use plastic chairs because they are lower maintenance considering we are ocean front.  Unfortunately, sometimes they break.  Yes, sometimes we have the problem of springs getting stretched out on the sofa beds from so much use, but we do replace them as needed.  It’s just that sometimes people walk across the sofa beds when they are opened because there isn’t much room to get in between the bed and sofa bed. All things considered, people are happy with the sofa beds.  If someone doesn’t like the sofa bed, we provide an aero bed upon request.  We do change the bedspreads as needed and our son regularly cleans the carpets using a method that doesn’t leave the carpets too wet.  He is good about keeping our carpets clean.  We are sorry if the shower backed up that day.  We do our best to keep all plumbing working well, and attend to any problem that arises.  We are sorry that you think the kitchens and bathrooms are too small.  We cannot do anything about the size of the rooms.  You just happened to be there right after we finished painting the exterior of the building, so the screens were down those days.  The screens were repaired as needed and reinstalled after you left and are always on the windows except during circumstances such as the painting or cleaning.  We couldn’t find anything wrong with the door in the bunk room.    We cannot do anything about the train, but honestly in the 30 years we have been here, we have had very few complaints about the train, most people enjoy the train.  Yes, we do charge for the room at check in.  A lot of motels do that.  If you had said when you checked in that you didn’t like the room, we would have refunded all your money.  Everyone has their own opinion and we respect that, but all things considered most people think our prices are fair.  Our rates are based on the season.  You were here during the spring so rates were a little more than winter rates, but not as much as summer rates.  Yes, there are a lot of cheaper hotels away from the water on El Camino Real.  It makes us sad that you weren’t happy when you were here.   John & Karen Gabay Managers

Summary: San Clemente is a very special place for me and my wife. At one time called the Western White House this was then the beach retreat for former President Richard Nixon and family. I can't say I've agreed much with Richard Nixon, but we do agree about this beautiful California coastal city on the Pacific Ocean. We've just returned from our second week ever in this oceanfront town. We stayed as before at the Beachcomber Inn overlooking the ocean and pier of this lovely place. Not being "on the beach" people we enjoyed looking out from our patio on the beach activity like surfing and fishing. The Beachcomber is a family run motel just above the beach. It is quite old, but clean and comfortable with motel type rooms. We chose one with a kitchenette and saved on breakfasts and

My husband and I stayed there several years past and will be staying again in October. We found the rooms to be very light, bright and airy.  Kitchen had everything we needed including a wine opener that I had forgotten. Then there is the view and location.  Just beautiful. I took so many pictures of the grounds, flowers, garden and rabbits not to mention the terrific shots available of the Pier and surrounding area. We were there for three days and altho we didn't require any help from staff, they seemed very friendly upon checking in. The room was clean and comfortable, loved sitting out on the patio area and just a easy, nice walk to all the fine eateries and the beach. I have just recommended this to a friend for she, her husband and 2 year old for a nice get-away.  I didn't

The beauty of this little motel is the location and the view, the rooms are quaint and in very good condition considering this motel was built in the 1940's. The grounds are unique and very well maintained. For me, the huge panoramic window view, the porch areas, and the immaculate lawn overlooking the beach all contributed to the sense of feeling the ocean on your doorstep and in your spirit. What a great place to relax. The sound of the waves kissing the shore, carressing my ears in the evening, these are the things that I looked forward to and found quite satisfying. The staff was attentive to my needs and extended extra effort to take care of me and assure I was happy. 4th of July was a busy day at the motel with a party and many many people sharing the lawn and

If you are looking for a place to stay near great surfing and body boarding, with no frills this is the place! My two teenage sons and I spent a weekend sharing a studio with a queen bed and queen sofa, a kitchen, bathroom and cable TV. Clean!  The view is 5 star!  You can easily walk to the beach which is a stones throw from your front door. Cafes and restaurants within 3 minute walk. Need surf/beach equipment and outerwear, Hobie and Killer Dana shops are withing 1.5 miles. The local Amtrak train does get noisy,but frankly after 8 hours in the water I doubt we heard it after the first few times. These are well build bungalows, we met some nice families with many many smaller children and it was quite peaceful. The small BBQ can be a social gathering point and the fire pit is a

The location of this motel is amazing. Right on the sea front with amazing views. Next to the pier and few restaurants on your door step. Rooms are slightly outdated but the view makes up for this. The quibble I have is the service, no welcome or pleasant introductions. More of yep this is your room and this is how much you have to pay. Here is your key and that was it. They could do with working on this. Parking is limited also. But you can park on the street. Long as you are up by 10am to top up your parking metre you'll be ok. Other wise it could be expensive unless you are prepared to camp out at the car park for a free space.  There is also a train track between property and beach, Amtrak seem to run a regular service. When a train does come through be prepared for the horn

Do not stay here!!!  I can't begin to describe how much of a rip-off this place is.  It is as expensive as a 5 star hotel with the quality of a motel from the early 50's.  I saw roaches in my bathroom and kitchen, there was mold growing in the shower, and the entire place smelled of sewage.    The veiw was pretty good, but you can go to the free beach and get the same (free) view.  The owners are ridiculous and rude, I take that back the entire family is rude.  They act like the are too busy to care or help.    I can't stress how much nicer/cleaner/better the other hotels in town are.  Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this scam.
Manager Response: One year has now gone by since we received this review.  You still haven't contacted us in any way.  This is very disturbing to us. Everybody has to take the good with the bad, but we have to say this time the procedure of Trip Advisor is not working.  No one can say for sure if this person even ever stayed here or if they were writing about the Beachcomber Motel.  With no reply, we think this review should be eliminated.  It must have been a mistake.  Maybe Trip Advisor should rethink their procedures because we think this review is unfair to have on our review list.

Summary: We stayed one week at the Beachcomber Motel. It was a little cramped for 2 adults and 2 kids but we survived just fine. The owners were great and very responsive to any requests we had. (a sink that clogged was fixed right away) The location on the beach is superb. We could see our 11 year old in the water on his boogie board from outside our room.  It was very relaxing to just sit on chairs in the grass with a wonderful view.  You can walk to any kind of restaurant with a great breakfast across the Street. Just know that trains go by early and can get a bit noisy. We would return to this special Motel.

This was a great place to stay. My husband and I are not picky, we just wanted something as close to the beach as possible for a reasonable price.  Simple, clean rooms, with a sink, refrigerator, stove, coffee pot and dishes. We could live in the room and be perfectly content. Wonderful ocean view and beautiful, gated grounds. In my opinion this is the best place to stay in San Clemente if what you are looking for is a place on the beach close to everything in town for a fair price. Big window and front porch to look out at the ocean (which is why you're here, right?). Just a short walk to the pier and delicious Fisherman's Restaurant. The train did not bother us at all. In fact, it was kind of nice. The bathroom is tiny, but clean. The bed was comfy and the heater really puts

Summary Heading: EXCELLENT MOTEL...ONLY MOTEL ON THE BEACH SIDE BY THE PIER..AWESOME VIEW
Summary: I have read some of the reviews and wanted to let everyone know that this is the best little motel in San Clemente that is along the beach and by the pier.  I have not stayed here recently but I have stayed here several times in the past.   My sister stayed recently and has also stayed here several times with her husband.  The owners actually live on the property and are always friendly and courteous.  Once I left some of my daughters clothes and blankets in the dresser drawer there and I called 2 days after we left and I spoke to the owner and she said that she had all of my clothes I left which included some homemade blankets that my mother made.  I was very thankful they did not toss away or give away to someone.  Every room has an awesome view because they all face the

Stayed here for a long weekend in June. If you read the reviews of this motel on TripAdvisor, you will find one complaining about the blinds not closing, no A/C, small accomodations and more.  I would not quarrel with any of those comments.  But at the Beachcomber, you are not checking into a plush resort, which you can probably figure out pretty quickly.  Instead, it is a locally owned property and kind of a throwback to an earlier time.  No phones in the room, spotty cell service, no wi fi.  We had a fabulous time.  The view is spectacular.  The owners/managers are very friendly and helpful.  The grounds are gorgeous and meticulously kept.  You can't beat sitting around a firepit in the evening, watching the sunset and drinking a glass of wine. Yes, you are paying premium for

We had seen this motel 5 years ago and my wife said we had to stay there at least one night during our next trip to CA.  It is somewhat pricey for us ($220) but we booked Saturday night and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The location is unbeatable with a large green lawn overlooking the Pacific Ocean and San Clemente pier.  The area was quiet and the sunset was beautiful, the room was really more of an efficiency with full size refrigerator, stove, microwave and queen size bed.   The place is old and hasn't been updated but that just seemed to add to the charm.

Summary Heading: Open your door and the beach is right there..
Summary: I decided to take my boyfriend to San Clemente for a suprise birthday weekend. This is the closest property to the beach! It rests on a cliff overlooking the beach. The room we stayed in was clean, had a spectacular view, and had a full kitchen (complete with pots, pans, plates, etc.)that we used on our first night.  The room we stayed in was clean and well maintained. What you are surrounded by plus their decent rates is a steal! The Beachcomber Motel is a neat little place to stay if you enjoy the whole panoramic view of the beach and if you enjoy waking up to the sounds of the beach. To add, in the evenings they have these little fire pits that you can warm up to while you enjoy the scenery.  One thing that may be a problem for some people is that there is an Amtrak and

We just spent a week at this darling place during the holidays and fell absolutely in love with it. Not a 5 star experience, but just an honest to goodness fun, relaxing week. The rooms are clean and have fully equipped kitchens. You don't stay at the Beachcomber for the rooms, though. You stay for the amazing views. There are 180 degree views from each room. The owners have plenty of chaise lounges, picnic tables and grills etc on their expansive lawn located on a  hill right above the San Clemente pier. There is literally nothing between you and the view. We sat on our front balcony every night for happy hour amazed at the gorgeous sunset highlighting the pier with Catalina and San Clemente islands in the distance. The owners have an amazing fire pit that we utilized most

I give this an excellent rating mainly for the view, and the old-time quaintness of the place.  It really is a throwback to the 50's, and there are far too few places like it anymore.  There is nothing like sitting on your little porch, or around the fire pit, drinking wine and watching the sun set over the Pacific.    Two minor complaints - the shower is small, and it was hard to maintain a consistant temperature.  And the surf was so loud, I had to put in my earplugs to sleep!  :-)

The Beachcomber Motel was full so we bought 2 nights at the "Villa" (apartment) they manage across the street.  The location was perfect--just like the photo on the web site shows.  Open the door and there was the pier, the beach, and the surf.  So, naturally at $200 per night you're definitely paying for the location.  The room was clean, but the whole builiding was poorly maintained.  The first thing you see when opening the gate is crumbling stucco on the exterior, and crumbling steps (surprisingly) up to the owners residence.  Windows & doors don't close easily, and the whole place needed some TLC.  The apartment is tiny, there's no closet in the sleeping area (which is separated from the living area by curtians.) And the bathroom is off the kitchen rather than the sleeping

We stayed here for three nights at the end of February.  What a great motel.  You cannot beat the view!  Amazing! Our room was very clean.  I usually go into a hotel spraying lysol everywhere but not here.  You can tell the owners take great care of this place.  Parking was a little tight with our big truck but we managed.  We stayed in room #1.  It was a one bedroom and our five year old son loved the bunkbeds.  Fishermans Restaurant on the pier was so delicious (the freshest seafood) and it's a great place to catch the sunset.    We will definitely be staying at the Beachcomber again!

We stayed here for a week at the end of December.  Older place but well maintained and clean.  Location is nice.  Parking is very tight and the trains can - and do - wake you up at night.  Lots of little touches that show the innkeepers care.  Grounds are nice and there is lots of character here.  Rooms are basic but clean.  Bathroom and shower are very tiny and water temp varies depending on whether other guests are running their showers.  Kitchenette is small but functional.  Great place if you like to take morning walks/runs.  The Pier is right there with lots of activity.  There are a few restaurants just down the street as well as the Amtrack train stop.  Owners were pleasant and helpful.  Overall a nice atmosphere, reasonably priced, and very relaxing.  Laid back.  We

I have some family friends that have been raving about the beachcomber for years, and this year we decided to give it a go.  The view is amazing and you are walking distance from the pier, about three or four great places to eat, and the beach...  the biggest downside for me was that you are separated from the beach by traintracks, and the only thing separating the rooms from the tracks is a great big steep hill.  my wife and I were accompanied by our two children (5 and 2) so obviously this brought a little more of a concern than if we travelled alone.  The train itself really wasn't a big deal though.  It comes by occasionaly and sometimes you hear the horn, but you really can't beat the beachcomber.  Just know going into it that it's old school.  The property is beautiful,

I live within walking distance of this hotel and run past it all the time.  I have never stayed there so I cannot comment on the rooms or the service, but the view is stunning.  This is the closest to the water you can get and the grounds are green and gorgeous.  They have the only patch of grass around.  The hotel is so quaint looking from the outside and each room at this ranch style, single story building, has it's own little porch with chairs and sits on a bluff right over the sand.  It is just steps away from the pier and the Fisherman's restaurant.  This is the best place for amazing clam chowder and out of this world, hot fresh loaves of sourdough bread. The only possible drawback is that you are above the Amtrack train track and the whistle blows from time to time.

What I didn't know after checking in for two nights: parking spaces are in short supply and miserably close together, my room did not have a phone or AC, nor drapes (the vertical miniblinds didn't completely close-so no privacy), the door barely shut, and my bathroom sink was honestly the smallest and shortest I have every experienced in my extensive travels.  Oh yes, the Amtrack train tracks are less than 100 ft away.  But the view is terrific. It's just no where near the $495 (tax included) I paid for two nights. I fled after one night.  Will never return.

I've had many family members stay here and its the best access to the best beach in California. Beautiful sunsets and walking distance to "main" street and pier. Great restaurant on the pier - Fishermans Wharf and breakfast joint across the street. Lots of surfers and locals to watch. The hotel is an "old fashioned" motel, but the only place to listen to the waves all night. You pay $$ for convenience, but we are never disappointed. Don't expect anything plush and only one or two rooms have phones. Cell phone service is also spotty, so know that you will just have to be out of touch. When you come to San Clemente, this is the best place to just relax

We had a studio room with a small kitchenette that was very nice but the greatest thing is the view. We had a small porch on the front of the room if you want to sit and watch the ocean or you could have a small fire in the yard. It was a short walk to the beach and to the pier.  If you look at the pictures on their website only imagine it being 100 times better. I couldn't of had a better Valentines Day present for my wife  Thank you Beachcomber
